turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Bala Brothers.
turn.2: The Bala Brothers The Bala Brothers are a vocal trio from the Kwa Nobuhle Township outside Port Elizabeth in the Eastern Cape.
turn.3: Who are the members of the vocal trio?
turn.4: The group consists of brothers Zwai Bala, Loyiso Bala, and Phelo Bala.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The brothers first gained prominence when Zwai Bala joined the Drakensberg Boys' Choir School in 1988, becoming the first black member of the previously segregated group six years before the end of apartheid. The brothers were born into a musical family.
turn.7: Do they have any other members in their family?
turn.8: The brother's parents first met singing in church choirs, and their grandfather was a choral composer.
turn.9: Did they face any hardships or obstacles in their career?
turn.10: In 1988, at age 12, Zwai Bala made history by becoming the first black member of the then-segregated Drakensberg Boys' Choir School.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: In 1995, after his time in Choir School, Zwai joined Kwaito group TKZee.
